page.title: 18 LIVING IN EAST BUDLEIGH
page.content: BY PIP BUTCHER-SIXTH FORMER aged 18 East Budleigh seems a typical rural community and I don't think I would like to have lived anywhere else.The problems are connected with social facilities and transport.Most clubs are centred round the elderly-obviously a high proportion of the population are retired.When I was in my early teens,I felt so limited in the choice of shops, company and leisure activities and it was difficult to get anywhere.These disadvantages,however, were soon outweighed by the benefit of living in a small,close-knit community.It is nice to be known by nearly everyone and have them interested in what you are doing. Living here is not so practical for travel to school,work or shops but despite this the population is still growing-so life here must be good!
